Class BinarySearchTree<K extends Comparable<K>, D>

java.lang.Object
datastructure.tree.BinaryTree<K,D>
datastructure.tree.BinarySearchTree<K,D>
Type Parameters:
K - type of the key value
D - type of the data object
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tree<K,D>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AVLTree
public class BinarySearchTree<K extends Comparable<K>, D> extends BinaryTree<K,D> implements Tree<K,D>
Binary Search Tree implementation

  • Method Details

    • insert

      public void insert(K key, D data) throws IllegalStateException
      Inserts a node storing the mapping (key,data) into the Binary Search Tree; Cost: O(h)

      Null key values are not allowed, while null data values are allowed. Same costs as insertNode

      Specified by:
      insert in interface Tree<K extends Comparable<K>, D>
      Specified by:
      insert in class BinaryTree<K extends Comparable<K>, D>
      Parameters:
      key - key value
      data - data mapped to the key value
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the key paramenter is null

    • insertNode

      protected void insertNode(BinaryTree<K,D>.BTNode node)
      Inserts node into the Binary Search Tree; Cost: O(h)

      Inserting a new node involves searching for the insertion position along a root-leaf path

      • Worst-case cost: Θ(h);
      • Average-case cost: Θ(h)
      • Best-case cost: O(1)

      where h is the tree height and h the average tree height

      Parameters:
      node - node to insert into the tree

    • search

      public D search(K key)
      Returns the data stored in the first node in the Binary Search Tree matching key; Cost: O(h)

      } /** Returns the data stored in the first node in the Binary Search Tree matching key; Cost: O(h)

      Same costs as searchNode

      Specified by:
      search in interface Tree<K extends Comparable<K>, D>
      Specified by:
      search in class BinaryTree<K extends Comparable<K>, D>
      Parameters:
      key - key value to search
      Returns:
      the data mapped to key or null if key is not in the tree

    • searchNode

      protected BinaryTree<K,D>.BTNode searchNode(K key)
      Searches and returns the first node matching key; Cost: O(h)

      Equivalent to a linear search on a root-leaf path

      • Worst-case cost: Θ(h);
      • Average-case cost: Θ(h)
      • Best-case cost: O(1)

      where h is the tree height and h the average tree height

      Parameters:
      key - key value to search
      Returns:
      the searched node or null

    • delete

      public D delete(K key)
      Deletes the first node matching key; Cost: O(h)

      Same costs as deleteNode

      Specified by:
      delete in interface Tree<K extends Comparable<K>, D>
      Specified by:
      delete in class BinaryTree<K extends Comparable<K>, D>
      Parameters:
      key - key value to search
      Returns:
      the data mapped to key or null if key is not in the tree

    • deleteNode

      protected BinaryTree<K,D>.BTNode deleteNode(K key)
      Disconnects (and returns) from the Binary Search Tree the first node with key value key; Cost: O(h)

      The procedure does not erase the parent pointer of the disconnected node. In this way it is possible to traverse the tree from the disconnected node up to the root node and update local infomation in each node in the path.

      • Worst-case cost: Θ(h)
      • Average-case cost: Θ(h)
      • Best-case cost: O(1)

      where h is the tree height and h the average tree height

      Parameters:
      key - a key value
      Returns:
      a node with key value key or null

    • size
